CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 2, 1960, pg. B2, reads: "Mr. and Mrs. Fred Pryor - Harris Photo." Article reads: "Smith-Pryor Rites Told - Miss Shirley E. Smith became the bride of Fred D. Pryor in solemn ritual performed recently in Central Baptist Church by Rev. Cornell Talley.  Given in marriage by her father, the bride wore stunning floor-length gown of Chantilly lace. Her sister, Dolores Nisby, was matron of honor and James Pryor Sr., was best man.  Lovely bridesmaids were: Ridley Logan, Jean Anderson, Susie Price and Gloria Walker.  Ushers were, Robert Frederick, Leon Howard, Joe Barrow, Donald English and Eugene Blair.  Marsha Sumpter was flower girl and James Jryor [Pryor] Jr. was ring bearer.  A reception followed immediately after the rites at Westray Plaza.  Out-of-town guests included: Mrs. Irene Kilgo, aunt of the bride from Philadelphia, and Fred Pryor Sr. of Detroit."
TitMainTitle: Groom Fred D. Pryor walking bride Shirley E. Smith Pryor wearing eyeglasses and crown with veil, down aisle, away from altar, in Central Baptist Church
